19.text: University Challenge. Asking the questions, Jeremy Paxman.

28.text: Hello. Oxford plays Cambridge tonight as two institutions

31.text: with daunting reputations in this contest

34.text: compete for the first of the two quarterfinal victories

37.text: they'll need to take a place in the semifinals.

40.text: Now the team from Magdalen College, Oxford,

44.text: that has taken the title of series champions four times in the past,

48.text: a distinction they share only with Manchester University.

51.text: Their journey towards what they hope will be a fifth victory

54.text: has seen them defeat Pembroke College, Cambridge,

57.text: by 220 points to 120 in the first round

60.text: and the Open University by 225 to 130 in the second.

65.text: With an accumulated score therefore of 445,

68.text: let's meet the Magdalen team for the third time.

73.text: I'm from Stone in Staffordshire, and I'm reading classics.

76.text: Hi, I'm Chris Savory from Burgess Hill in West Sussex

80.text:
- Their captain. 
- Hello, my name's Hugh Binnie.

82.text: I live near Cheltenham near Gloucestershire,

86.text: Hello, I'm Cameron J Quinn, originally

88.text: from Los Angeles, California, and I read philosophy and French.

95.text: Now teams from Trinity College, Cambridge,

98.text: have taken the series title on three occasions,

101.text: and they are, or course, the current reigning champions.

104.text: Their latest team has already dismissed

107.text: the University of St Andrews in round one with 150 points to 100

111.text: and Leicester University in round two by 220 to 140.

115.text: With an accumulated score, therefore, of 370,

118.text: let's meet the Trinity team for the third time.

122.text: Hi, I'm Matthew. I'm from London and I study physics.

125.text: Hello, I'm Claire. I'm from Greenwich in London and I study classics.

130.text: Hi, I'm Hugh. I'm from London and I'm studying chemistry.

133.text: Hi, I'm Aled. I'm from Birmingham and I'm studying maths.
